item.title: Report E-2024050030
item.description:
Report E-2024050030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from five (5) 1-gallon metal pails due to falling freight. The terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaned up the released material. The recovered material was containerized into two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from nine (9) 1-gallon metal pails. The released material impacted the trailer floor and cardboard packaging. Dayton Freight cleaned the released material and placed the damaged 1-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050025
item.description:
Report E-2024050025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was torn due to a load shift and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TLE personnel utilized a HEPA filtered drum vacuum to remove any free-standing product from the impacted area. All undamaged cargo was wiped with absorbent pads to remove any residual product and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2024050013
item.description:
Report E-2024050013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1992 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1992-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon overpack and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050000
item.description:
Report E-2024050000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1719 Pentrate Ultra Liquid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4â€™ x 4â€™ area of the pallet and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Kolor-Safe was then deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted pallet and absorbents were containerized into a second 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040658
item.description:
Report E-2024040658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged jug and deployed absorbents to the release. The crew worked them in with hand tools and further utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to further remediate the area. All UN1824 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum and two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.
